string.text:
The SKS is one of the first weapons chambered for the 7.62x39mm round. Replaced in Soviet front-line service by the AK-47 in the early 1950s, it remained in second-line service for decades and is still used as a ceremonial arm today.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
%c[d_purple]• %c[ui_gray_2] none

Molot OP-SKS Carbine is designed for loading with 7.62x39 - the very popular ammunition in Zone. The weight and dimensions make the carbine ergonomic for shooters of any age and height.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Scopes: all scopes for Dovetail mount
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Silencer: None

Molot OP-SKS Carbine is designed for loading with 7.62x39 - the very popular ammunition in Zone. The weight and dimensions make the carbine ergonomic for shooters of any age and height. The tactical option differs from the original in the presence of a mount for installing sights in the fore-end area and also the possibility of installing a silence. Also new light trigger was installed on this model that significantly increased the rate of fire
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] SKS SOCOM Rail: Integrated 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Scopes: all scopes for Dovetail mount and all red dot sights (except of Aimpoint PRO and Aimpoint T1 with high mount)
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Silencer: PBS-1 suppressor
